event.title: was opened for settlement on May 15, 1854

data.event: Douglas County was opened for settlement on May 15, 1854, and was named for Stephen A. Douglas, a senator from Illinois.

event.title: years as leaders in Lecompton, the territorial capital, wanted

data.event: The county was practically at the center of the Bleeding Kansas years as leaders in Lecompton, the territorial capital, wanted Kansas to be a slave state and leaders in Lawrence wanted Kansas to be a free state.

event.title: was built through that territory in 1864

data.event: The first railroad in Douglas County, the Union Pacific, was built through that territory in 1864.
